form.note: The base form of the verb used with the enclitic 'animal' is the same as that of the formal masculine singular. This pattern is also true for enclitics for the general pronoun ña, 'child' tsi; 'wood' tu; 'spherical' ti; 'deity' ya; 'water/liquid' ra; (3.inf kui or its free variant vi), thus the form for animal should be consulted when looking up the inflection of any of the aforementioned.
Alternatively the pronoun could be kuena.

The base form of the verb used with the enclitic 'animal' is the same as that of the rest of the 3rd person plural forms. This pattern of adding the clitic seen in the singular form to the plural marker to form the specific plural pronoun is also true for enclitics for the general pronoun kueña; 'children', kuetsi; 'wood', kuetu; 'spherical', kueti 'deity', kueya; 'water/liquid' kuera; thus the form for animal should be consulted when looking up the inflectio of any of the aforementioned. Note however that this is not the case for the alternative 3rd person pronoun kui, or its free variant vi which may be used for both singular or plural.
